summary.span: 表示一个异步操作。

span.span: Represents an asynchronous operation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 类的表示单个操作不会返回一个值，通常以异步方式执行。The class represents a single operation that does not return a value and that usually executes asynchronously. 对象是一种的中心组件[基于任务的异步模式](~/docs/standard/asynchronous-programming-patterns/task-based-asynchronous-pattern-tap.md)首次在.NET Framework 4 中引入。 objects are one of the central components of the [task-based asynchronous pattern](~/docs/standard/asynchronous-programming-patterns/task-based-asynchronous-pattern-tap.md) first introduced in the .NET Framework 4. 由于由执行工作对象通常以异步方式执行线程池线程上而不是以同步方式主应用程序线程，因此你可以使用属性，以及， ，和属性，以确定任务的状态。Because the work performed by a object typically executes asynchronously on a thread pool thread rather than synchronously on the main application thread, you can use the property, as well as the , , and properties, to determine the state of a task. 通常情况下，lambda 表达式用于指定的任务是执行的工作。Most commonly, a lambda expression is used to specify the work that the task is to perform. 对于返回值的操作，你使用类。For operations that return values, you use the class. 本节内容：In this section: [任务实例化示例](#Instant) [Task instantiation examples](#Instant) [创建和执行任务](#Creating) [Creating and executing a task](#Creating) [分隔开来将任务创建和执行](#Separating) [Separating task creation and execution](#Separating) [等待一个或多个任务完成](#WaitingForOne) [Waiting for one or more tasks to complete](#WaitingForOne) [任务和区域性](#Culture) [Tasks and culture](#Culture) [对于调试器开发人员For debugger developers](#Debugger) ## 任务实例化Task instantiation 下面的示例创建并执行四个任务。The following example creates and executes four tasks. 三个任务执行委托名为`action`，这样便可以接受类型的自变量。Three tasks execute an delegate named `action`, which accepts an argument of type . 第四个任务执行 lambda 表达式 (委托)，它是以内联方式定义的任务创建方法的调用中。A fourth task executes a lambda expression (an delegate) that is defined inline in the call to the task creation method. 每个任务是实例化并运行以不同的方式：Each task is instantiated and run in a different way: - 任务`t1`调用任务类构造函数，通过实例化，但通过调用会启动其任务后，才方法`t2`已开始。Task `t1` is instantiated by calling a Task class constructor, but is started by calling its method only after task `t2` has started. - 任务`t2`实例化并通过调用在单个方法调用中启动方法。Task `t2` is instantiated and started in a single method call by calling the method. - 任务`t3`实例化并通过调用在单个方法调用中启动方法。Task `t3` is instantiated and started in a single method call by calling the method. - 任务`t4`上同步执行主线程通过调用方法。Task `t4` is executed synchronously on the main thread by calling the method. 因为任务`t4`以同步方式，执行它在主应用程序线程上执行。Because task `t4` executes synchronously, it executes on the main application thread. 剩余的任务执行异步通常在一个或多个线程池线程上。The remaining tasks execute asynchronously typically on one or more thread pool threads. [!code-csharp[System.Threading.Tasks.Task#01](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task/cs/startnew.cs#01)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.Tasks.Task#01](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task/vb/startnew.vb#01)] ## 创建和执行任务Creating and executing a task 实例可能会创建各种不同的方式。 instances may be created in a variety of ways. 最常用的方法，即从开始提供[!INCLUDE[net_v45](~/includes/net-v45-md.md)]，是调用静态方法。The most common approach, which is available starting with the [!INCLUDE[net_v45](~/includes/net-v45-md.md)], is to call the static method. 方法提供了一种简单的方法启动任务使用默认值，而无需其他参数。The method provides a simple way to start a task using default values and without requiring additional parameters. 下面的示例使用方法以启动循环，然后显示的循环迭代数的任务：The following example uses the method to start a task that loops and then displays the number of loop iterations: [!code-csharp[System.Threading.Tasks.Task#6](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task/cs/run1.cs#6)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.Tasks.Task#6](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task/vb/run1.vb#6)] 一种替代方法，并启动任务的最常见方法[!INCLUDE[net_v40_short](~/includes/net-v40-short-md.md)]，是静态方法。An alternative, and the most common method to start a task in [!INCLUDE[net_v40_short](~/includes/net-v40-short-md.md)], is the static method. 属性返回对象。The property returns a object. 重载的方法，你可以指定要传递给任务创建选项和任务计划程序参数。Overloads of the method let you specify parameters to pass to the task creation options and a task scheduler. 下面的示例使用方法启动任务来。The following example uses the method to start a task. 它在功能上等效于在前面的示例代码。It is functionally equivalent to the code in the previous example. [!code-csharp[System.Threading.Tasks.Task#7](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task/cs/startnew1.cs#7)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.Tasks.Task#7](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task/vb/startnew1.vb#7)] 有关更完整示例，请参阅[基于任务的异步编程](~/docs/standard/parallel-programming/task-based-asynchronous-programming.md)。For more complete examples, see [Task-based Asynchronous Programming](~/docs/standard/parallel-programming/task-based-asynchronous-programming.md). ## 分隔开来将任务创建和执行Separating task creation and execution 类还提供了构造函数对任务进行初始化，但的未计划的执行。The class also provides constructors that initialize the task but that do not schedule it for execution. 出于性能原因，或方法是用于创建和计划计算的任务的首选的机制，但对于创建和计划必须分开的方案，你可以使用的构造函数，然后调用方法来计划在以后执行的任务。For performance reasons, the or method is the preferred mechanism for creating and scheduling computational tasks, but for scenarios where creation and scheduling must be separated, you can use the constructors and then call the method to schedule the task for execution at a later time. ## 等待一个或多个任务完成Waiting for one or more tasks to complete 因为任务通常运行以异步方式在线程池线程上，创建和启动任务的线程将继续执行，一旦该任务已实例化。Because tasks typically run asynchronously on a thread pool thread, the thread that creates and starts the task continues execution as soon as the task has been instantiated. 在某些情况下，当调用的线程的主应用程序线程，应用程序可能会终止任何之前任务操作实际开始执行。In some cases, when the calling thread is the main application thread, the app may terminate before any the task actually begins execution. 其他情况下，你的应用程序逻辑可能需要调用线程继续执行，仅在一个或多个任务已完成执行时。In others, your application's logic may require that the calling thread continue execution only when one or more tasks has completed execution. 你可以同步调用线程的执行异步任务和它将启动通过调用`Wait`方法来等待一个或多个任务完成。You can synchronize the execution of the calling thread and the asynchronous tasks it launches by calling a `Wait` method to wait for one or more tasks to complete. 若要等待完成单个任务，你可以调用其方法。To wait for a single task to complete, you can call its method. 调用方法阻止调用线程，直到已完成执行的单个类实例。A call to the method blocks the calling thread until the single class instance has completed execution. 下面的示例调用的无参数无条件地等待，直到任务完成的方法。The following example calls the parameterless method to wait unconditionally until a task completes. 该任务通过调用来模拟工作两秒钟进入睡眠状态的方法。The task simulates work by calling the method to sleep for two seconds. [!code-csharp[System.Threading.Tasks.Task#8](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task/cs/Wait1.cs#8)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.Tasks.Task#8](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task/vb/Wait1.vb#8)] 你可以有条件地等待任务完成。You can also conditionally wait for a task to complete. 和方法阻止调用线程，直到任务完成或超时间隔结束，不管先满足。The and methods block the calling thread until the task finishes or a timeout interval elapses, whichever comes first. 由于下面的示例将启动两秒钟休眠但定义了一秒超时值，调用线程受到阻止，直到在超时到期的任务之前, 已完成执行的任务。Since the following example launches a task that sleeps for two seconds but defines a one-second timeout value, the calling thread blocks until the timeout expires and before the task has completed execution. [!code-csharp[System.Threading.Tasks.Task#9](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task/cs/Wait2.cs#9)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.Tasks.Task#9](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task/vb/Wait2.vb#9)] 你也可以通过调用提供一个取消标记和方法。You can also supply a cancellation token by calling the and methods. 如果令牌的属性是`true`，取消等待; 如果为真时方法终止。If the token's property is `true`, the wait is cancelled; if it becomes true while the method terminates. 在某些情况下，你可能想要等待的执行的任务序列的第一个完成，但不是任务它的小心。In some cases, you may want to wait for the first of a series of executing tasks to complete, but don't care which task it is. 出于此目的，您可以调用的重载之一方法。For this purpose, you can call one of the overloads of the method. 下面的示例创建三个任务，其中每个休眠时间间隔确定由随机数生成器。The following example creates three tasks, each of which sleeps for an interval determine by a random number generator. 方法等待第一个任务完成。The method waits for the first task to complete. 然后，此示例显示所有三个任务的状态的信息。The example then displays information about the status of all three tasks. [!code-csharp[System.Threading.Tasks.Task#10](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task/cs/WhenAny1.cs#10)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.Tasks.Task#10](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task/vb/WaitAny1.vb#10)] 你也可以等待所有任务完成通过调用一系列方法。You can also wait for all of a series of tasks to complete by calling the method. 下面的示例创建十个任务、 等待所有 10 个若要完成，然后显示其状态。The following example creates ten tasks, waits for all ten to complete, and then displays their status. [!code-csharp[System.Threading.Tasks.Task#11](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task/cs/WaitAll1.cs#11)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.Tasks.Task#11](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task/vb/WaitAll1.vb#11)] 请注意在等待一个或多个任务完成时，任何正在运行的任务中引发的异常会传播调用的线程上`Wait`方法，如以下示例所示。Note that when you wait for one or more tasks to complete, any exceptions thrown in the running tasks are propagated on the thread that calls the `Wait` method, as the following example shows. 它将启动 12 任务，其中的三种正常方式完成和三个异常的引发。It launches 12 tasks, three of which complete normally and three of which throw an exception. 剩余的六项任务，三个早于开始日期，取消和三个将被取消时执行它们。Of the remaining six tasks, three are cancelled before the start, and three are cancelled while they executing. 在中引发异常方法调用和是否由处理`try` / `catch`块。Exceptions are thrown in the method call and are handled by a `try`/`catch` block. [!code-csharp[System.Threading.Tasks.Task#12](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task/cs/WaitAll2.cs#12)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.Tasks.Task#12](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task/vb/WaitAll2.vb#12)] 有关基于任务的异步操作中的异常处理的详细信息，请参阅[异常处理](~/docs/standard/parallel-programming/exception-handling-task-parallel-library.md)。For more information on exception handling in task-based asynchronous operations, see [Exception Handling](~/docs/standard/parallel-programming/exception-handling-task-parallel-library.md). ## 任务和区域性Tasks and culture 从桌面应用程序面向[!INCLUDE[net_v46](~/includes/net-v46-md.md)]，创建和调用任务的线程的区域性将成为线程的上下文的一部分。Starting with desktop apps that target the [!INCLUDE[net_v46](~/includes/net-v46-md.md)], the culture of the thread that creates and invokes a task becomes part of the thread's context. 也就是说，无论当前区域性执行该任务时的线程，任务的当前区域性为调用线程的区域性。That is, regardless of the current culture of the thread on which the task executes, the current culture of the task is the culture of the calling thread. 对于面向.NET Framework，之前版本的应用， [!INCLUDE[net_v46](~/includes/net-v46-md.md)]，任务的区域性为执行该任务时的线程的区域性。For apps that target versions of the .NET Framework prior to the [!INCLUDE[net_v46](~/includes/net-v46-md.md)], the culture of the task is the culture of the thread on which the task executes. 有关详细信息，请参阅中的"区域性和基于任务的异步操作"部分主题。For more information, see the "Culture and task-based asynchronous operations" section in the topic. > [!NOTE] > 应用商店应用程序按照 Windows 运行时中设置和获取的默认区域性。Store apps follow the Windows Runtime in setting and getting the default culture. ## 对于调试器开发人员For debugger developers 实现自定义调试器的开发人员而言，对于多个任务的内部和私有成员会很有用 （这些可能会更改从发行版本而异）。For developers implementing custom debuggers, several internal and private members of task may be useful (these may change from release to release). `m_taskId`字段用作后备存储属性，但是访问直接从调试器的此字段可能比通过属性的 getter 方法访问相同的值更高效 (`s_taskIdCounter`计数器是用于检索一项任务的下一个可用 ID）。The `m_taskId` field serves as the backing store for the property, however accessing this field directly from a debugger may be more efficient than accessing the same value through the property's getter method (the `s_taskIdCounter` counter is used to retrieve the next available ID for a task). 同样，`m_stateFlags`字段存储有关当前的生命周期阶段的任务，还可通过访问信息的信息属性。Similarly, the `m_stateFlags` field stores information about the current lifecycle stage of the task, information also accessible through the property. `m_action`字段存储对该任务的委托的引用和`m_stateObject`字段存储由开发人员传递给任务的异步状态。The `m_action` field stores a reference to the task's delegate, and the `m_stateObject` field stores the async state passed to the task by the developer. 最后，为分析堆栈帧的调试器`InternalWait`方法处理任务时输入等待操作的潜在标记。Finally, for debuggers that parse stack frames, the `InternalWait` method serves a potential marker for when a task is entering a wait operation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 而不是最常见的方法调用此构造函数来实例化对象并启动任务是通过调用静态或方法。Rather than calling this constructor, the most common way to instantiate a object and launch a task is by calling the static or method. 此构造函数提供的唯一好处是它允许对象实例化分离，从而可从任务调用。The only advantage offered by this constructor is that it allows object instantiation to be separated from task invocation. ## Examples 下面的示例使用构造函数来创建检索中的文件名的任务指定目录。The following example uses the constructor to create tasks that retrieve the filenames in specified directories. 所有任务都写入到单个文件名称对象。All tasks write the file names to a single object. 该示例然后调用方法，以确保所有的任务已完成，并且然后显示文件名写入的总数的计数对象。The example then calls the method to ensure that all tasks have completed, and then displays a count of the total number of file names written to the object. [!code-csharp[System.Threading.Tasks.Task.Ctor#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task.ctor/cs/ctor1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.Tasks.Task.Ctor#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task.ctor/vb/ctor1.vb#1)] 下面的示例是完全相同，只不过它使用方法来实例化并在单个操作中运行任务。The following example is identical, except that it used the method to instantiate and run the task in a single operation. 该方法返回表示任务的对象。The method returns the object that represents the task. [!code-csharp[System.Threading.Tasks.Task.Run#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task.run/cs/run2.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.Tasks.Task.Run#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task.run/vb/run2.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 而不是最常见的方法调用此构造函数来实例化对象并启动任务是通过调用静态和方法。Rather than calling this constructor, the most common way to instantiate a object and launch a task is by calling the static and methods. 此构造函数提供的唯一好处是它允许对象实例化分离，从而可从任务调用。The only advantage offered by this constructor is that it allows object instantiation to be separated from task invocation. 有关详细信息，请参阅[任务并行 （任务并行库）](~/docs/standard/parallel-programming/task-based-asynchronous-programming.md)和[托管线程中的取消](~/docs/standard/threading/cancellation-in-managed-threads.md)。For more information, see [Task Parallelism (Task Parallel Library)](~/docs/standard/parallel-programming/task-based-asynchronous-programming.md) and [Cancellation in Managed Threads](~/docs/standard/threading/cancellation-in-managed-threads.md). ## Examples 下面的示例调用构造函数来创建一个任务，它循环 C:\Windows\System32 目录中的文件。The following example calls the constructor to create a task that iterates the files in the C:\Windows\System32 directory. Lambda 表达式调用方法将添加到每个文件的信息对象。The lambda expression calls the method to add information about each file to a object. 每个分离的嵌套的任务由调用循环检查取消标记的状态，并且如果已请求取消，将调用方法。Each detached nested task invoked by the loop checks the state of the cancellation token and, if cancellation is requested, calls the method. 方法抛出异常中处理的异常`catch`时调用的线程调用阻止方法。The method throws an exception that is handled in a `catch` block when the calling thread calls the method. 然后调用方法来启动任务。The method is then called to start the task. [!code-csharp[System.Threading.Tasks.Task.ctor#4](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task.ctor/cs/run4.cs#4)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.Tasks.Task.ctor#4](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task.ctor/vb/run4.vb#4)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 而不是最常见的方法调用此构造函数来实例化对象并启动任务是通过调用静态方法。Rather than calling this constructor, the most common way to instantiate a object and launch a task is by calling the static method. 此构造函数提供的唯一好处是它允许对象实例化分离，从而可从任务调用。The only advantage offered by this constructor is that it allows object instantiation to be separated from task invocation. ## Examples 下面的示例定义 6 字母单词的数组。The following example defines an array of 6-letter words. 每个单词然后作为的自变量传递构造函数，其委托进行加密在 word 中的字符，则将显示原始 word 和其经过编码的版本。Each word is then passed as an argument to the constructor, whose delegate scrambles the characters in the word, then displays the original word and its scrambled version. remarks.format: ## Remarks 返回将不会计划执行当前的任务已完成，直到是否由于运行到成功完成、 出错由于未经处理的异常，或提前退出由于被取消而完成。The returned will not be scheduled for execution until the current task has completed, whether it completes due to running to completion successfully, faulting due to an unhandled exception, or exiting out early due to being canceled. ## Examples 下面的示例定义一个任务，它使用来填充数组 100 随机的日期和时间值。The following example defines a task that populates an array with 100 random date and time values. 它使用方法来选择最早和最新的日期值后完全填充数组。It uses the method to select the earliest and the latest date values once the array is fully populated. [!code-csharp[System.Threading.Tasks.Task.ContinueWith#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task.continuewith/cs/continuewith1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.Tasks.Task.ContinueWith#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task.continuewith/vb/continuewith1.vb#1)] 一个控制台应用程序可能会终止之前执行的延续任务，因为调用方法来确保延续任务完成之前在示例结束执行。Because a console application may terminate before the continuation task executes, the method is called to ensure that the continuation finishes executing before the example ends. 有关其他示例，请参阅[使用延续任务来链接任务](~/docs/standard/parallel-programming/chaining-tasks-by-using-continuation-tasks.md)。For an additional example, see [Chaining Tasks by Using Continuation Tasks](~/docs/standard/parallel-programming/chaining-tasks-by-using-continuation-tasks.md).

remarks.format: ## Remarks 返回当前任务完成之前不将执行计划。The returned will not be scheduled for execution until the current task has completed. 如果通过指定延续条件`continuationOptions`参数未满足，则将取消延续任务而不是计划。If the continuation criteria specified through the `continuationOptions` parameter are not met, the continuation task will be canceled instead of scheduled. ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何使用指定，当一个延续任务前面的任务完成时，应以同步方式运行。The following example demonstrates using to specify that a continuation task should run synchronously when the antecedent task completes. (如果指定的任务已完成时调用时，同步延续任务将运行的线程调用上。)(If the specified task has already completed by the time is called, the synchronous continuation will run on the thread calling .) ```csharp public class TaskCounter { private volatile int _count; public void Track(Task t) { if (t == null) throw new ArgumentNullException("t"); Interlocked.Increment(ref _count); t.ContinueWith(ct => Interlocked.Decrement(ref _count), TaskContinuationOptions.ExecuteSynchronously); } public int NumberOfActiveTasks { get { return _count; } } } ``` ```vb Public Class TaskCounter Private _count as Integer Public Sub Track(ByVal t as Task) If t is Nothing Then Throw New ArgumentNullException("t") Interlocked.Increment(_count) t.ContinueWith(Sub(ct) Interlocked.Decrement(_count) End Sub, TaskContinuationOptions.ExecuteSynchronously) End Sub Public ReadOnly Property NumberOfActiveTasks As Integer Get Return _count End Get End Property End Class ```

ContinueWith(delegate { UpdateUI(); }, uiScheduler). ContinueWith(delegate { DoAnotherBackgroundComputation(); }, backgroundScheduler). ContinueWith(delegate { UpdateUIAgain(); }, uiScheduler); } ``` ```vb Private Sub Button1_Click(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles Button1.Click Dim backgroundScheduler = TaskScheduler.Default Dim uiScheduler = TaskScheduler.FromCurrentSynchronizationContext() Task.Factory.StartNew(Sub() DoBackgroundComputation() End Sub, backgroundScheduler).ContinueWith(Sub(t) UpdateUI() End Sub, uiScheduler).ContinueWith(Sub(t) DoAnotherBackgroundComputation() End Sub, backgroundScheduler).ContinueWith(Sub(t) UpdateUIAgain() End Sub, uiScheduler) End Sub ```

remarks.format: ## Remarks 是`static`(`Shared`在 Visual Basic 中) 属性，用于执行任务的代码从获取当前正在执行的任务的标识符。 is a `static` (`Shared` in Visual Basic) property that is used to get the identifier of the currently executing task from the code that the task is executing. 它不同于属性，它返回特定的标识符实例。It differs from the property, which returns the identifier of a particular instance. 如果你尝试检索值的范围是从超出了执行任务的代码，该属性返回`null`。If you attempt to retrieve the value from outside the code that a task is executing, the property returns `null`. 请注意，虽然冲突非常少见，但任务不能保证标识符是唯一的。Note that although collisions are very rare, task identifiers are not guaranteed to be unique.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法通常用于延迟指定的时间间隔内的所有操作或任务的一部分。The method is typically used to delay the operation of all or part of a task for a specified time interval. 通常情况下，引入的时间延迟：Most commonly, the time delay is introduced: - At 开头的任务，如下面的示例演示。At the beginning of the task, as the following example shows. [!code-csharp[System.Threading.Tasks.Task.Delay#5](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task.delay/cs/delay5.cs#5)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.Tasks.Task.Delay#5](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task.delay/vb/delay5.vb#5)] - 一段时间时正在执行任务。Sometime while the task is executing. 在此情况下，调用如以下示例所示为任务中的子任务执行方法。In this case, the call to the method executes as a child task within a task, as the following example shows. 请注意，因为该任务调用方法以异步方式执行，父任务必须等待它完成通过使用`await`关键字。Note that since the task that calls the method executes asynchronously, the parent task must wait for it to complete by using the `await` keyword. [!code-csharp[System.Threading.Tasks.Task.Delay#7](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task.delay/cs/delay5.cs#7)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.Tasks.Task.Delay#7](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task.delay/vb/delay5.vb#7)] 指定的时间延迟后，将在任务完成中状态。After the specified time delay, the task is completed in the state. 此方法取决于系统时钟。This method depends on the system clock. 这意味着在时间延迟将大约等于系统时钟的分辨率，如果`millisecondsDelay`参数小于系统时钟，这是在 Windows 系统上的大约 15 毫秒的分辨率。This means that the time delay will approximately equal the resolution of the system clock if the `millisecondsDelay` argument is less than the resolution of the system clock, which is approximately 15 milliseconds on Windows systems. ## Examples 下面的示例演示使用简单的方法。The following example shows a simple use of the method. [!code-csharp[System.Threading.Tasks.Task.Delay#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task.delay/cs/delay1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.Tasks.Task.Delay#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task.delay/vb/delay1.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果之前指定的时间延迟，发出信号的取消标记异常结果和任务中完成状态。If the cancellation token is signaled before the specified time delay, a exception results, and the task is completed in the state. 否则，在完成此任务时状态后经过指定的时间延迟。Otherwise, the task is completed in the state once the specified time delay has elapsed. 有关使用方案和其他示例，请参阅的文档重载。For usage scenarios and additional examples, see the documentation for the overload. 此方法取决于系统时钟。This method depends on the system clock. 这意味着在时间延迟将大约等于系统时钟的分辨率，如果`millisecondsDelay`参数小于系统时钟，这是在 Windows 系统上的大约 15 毫秒的分辨率。This means that the time delay will approximately equal the resolution of the system clock if the `millisecondsDelay` argument is less than the resolution of the system clock, which is approximately 15 milliseconds on Windows systems. ## Examples 下面的示例将启动一个任务，它包括对的调用方法与一个秒延迟。The following example launches a task that includes a call to the method with a one second delay. 延迟间隔已过之前，标记被取消。Before the delay interval elapses, the token is cancelled. 示例输出显示，因此，引发，和任务的属性设置为。The output from the example shows that, as a result, a is thrown, and the tasks' property is set to . remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果之前指定的时间延迟，发出信号的取消标记异常结果和任务中完成状态。If the cancellation token is signaled before the specified time delay, a exception results, and the task is completed in the state. 否则，在完成此任务时状态后经过指定的时间延迟。Otherwise, the task is completed in the state once the specified time delay has elapsed. 有关使用方案和其他示例，请参阅的文档重载。For usage scenarios and additional examples, see the documentation for the overload. 此方法取决于系统时钟。This method depends on the system clock. 这意味着在时间延迟将大约等于系统时钟的分辨率，如果`delay`参数小于系统时钟，这是在 Windows 系统上的大约 15 毫秒的分辨率。This means that the time delay will approximately equal the resolution of the system clock if the `delay` argument is less than the resolution of the system clock, which is approximately 15 milliseconds on Windows systems. ## Examples 下面的示例将启动一个任务，它包括对的调用方法替换-a-1.5 秒延迟。The following example launches a task that includes a call to the method with a one-and-a-half second delay. 延迟间隔已过之前，标记被取消。Before the delay interval elapses, the token is cancelled. 示例输出显示，因此，引发，和任务的属性设置为。The output from the example shows that, as a result, a is thrown, and the tasks' property is set to . [!code-csharp[System.Threading.Tasks.Task.Delay#4](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task.delay/cs/delay4.cs#4)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.Tasks.Task.Delay#4](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task.delay/vb/delay4.vb#4)] 请注意此示例，包括潜在的争用条件： 它依赖于以异步方式执行延迟，在标记被取消的任务。Note that this example includes a potential race condition: it depends on the task asynchronously executing the delay when the token is cancelled. 尽管 1.5 的秒的延迟与调用方法进行该假设有可能，不过可以，调用方法无法返回之前取消了标记。Although the 1.5 second delay from the call to the method makes that assumption likely, it is nevertheless possible that the call to the method could return before the token is cancelled. 在这种情况下，该示例产生下面的输出：In that case, the example produces the following output: ``` Task t Status: RanToCompletion, Result: 42 ```

remarks.format: ## Remarks 引发未经处理的异常的任务存储生成的异常，并将其包装在传播调用或访问中属性。Tasks that throw unhandled exceptions store the resulting exception and propagate it wrapped in a in calls to or in accesses to the property. 按任务实例进行垃圾回收时间未观察到任何异常将在终结器线程上传播。Any exceptions not observed by the time the task instance is garbage collected will be propagated on the finalizer thread. 有关详细信息及示例，请参阅[异常处理 （任务并行库）](~/docs/standard/parallel-programming/exception-handling-task-parallel-library.md)。For more information and an example, see [Exception Handling (Task Parallel Library)](~/docs/standard/parallel-programming/exception-handling-task-parallel-library.md).

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法允许你创建和执行任务，在单个方法调用，并为一个更简单的替代方法方法。The method allows you to create and execute a task in a single method call and is a simpler alternative to the method. 使用以下默认值，它创建一个任务：It creates a task with the following default values: - 其取消标记是。Its cancellation token is . - 其属性值是。Its property value is . - 它使用默认任务计划程序。It uses the default task scheduler. 有关处理由任务操作引发的异常的信息，请参阅[异常处理](~/docs/standard/parallel-programming/exception-handling-task-parallel-library.md)。For information on handling exceptions thrown by task operations, see [Exception Handling](~/docs/standard/parallel-programming/exception-handling-task-parallel-library.md). ## Examples 下面的示例定义`ShowThreadInfo`方法，用于显示当前线程。The following example defines a `ShowThreadInfo` method that displays the of the current thread. 它称为直接从应用程序线程，并从调用委托传递给方法。It is called directly from the application thread, and is called from the delegate passed to the method. [!code-csharp[System.Threading.Tasks.Task.Run#11](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task.run/cs/Run11.cs#11)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.Tasks.Task.Run#11](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task.run/vb/Run11.vb#11)] 下面的示例等同于前一个，只不过它使用 lambda 表达式定义的任务是执行代码。The following example is similar to the previous one, except that it uses a lambda expression to define the code that the task is to execute. [!code-csharp[System.Threading.Tasks.Task.Run#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task.run/cs/run6.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.Tasks.Task.Run#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task.run/vb/run6.vb#3)] 示例说明在与主应用程序线程不同的线程上执行异步任务。The examples show that the asynchronous task executes on a different thread than the main application thread. 调用方法可确保在任务完成，并且显示在应用程序结束之前其输出。The call to the method ensures that the task completes and displays its output before the application ends. 否则，它是可能的`Main`方法将在任务完成之前完成。Otherwise, it is possible that the `Main` method will complete before the task finishes. 下面的示例演示方法。The following example illustrates the method. 它定义目录名的数组，并启动单独的任务来检索每个目录中的文件名称。It defines an array of directory names and starts a separate task to retrieve the file names in each directory. 所有任务都写入到单个文件名称对象。All tasks write the file names to a single object. 该示例然后调用方法，以确保所有的任务已完成，并且然后显示文件名写入的总数的计数对象。The example then calls the method to ensure that all tasks have completed, and then displays a count of the total number of file names written to the object. [!code-csharp[System.Threading.Tasks.Task.Run#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task.run/cs/run2.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.Tasks.Task.Run#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task.run/vb/run2.vb#1)]

Lambda 表达式调用方法将添加到每个文件的信息对象。The lambda expression calls the method to add information about each file to a object. 每个分离的嵌套的任务由调用循环检查取消标记的状态，并且如果已请求取消，将调用方法。Each detached nested task invoked by the loop checks the state of the cancellation token and, if cancellation is requested, calls the method. 方法抛出异常中处理的异常`catch`时调用的线程调用阻止方法。The method throws an exception that is handled in a `catch` block when the calling thread calls the method. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法是一个更简单的替代方法方法。The method is a simpler alternative to the method. 使用以下默认值，它创建一个任务：It creates a task with the following default values: - 其取消标记是。Its cancellation token is . - 其属性值是。Its property value is . - 它使用默认任务计划程序。It uses the default task scheduler. 有关处理由任务操作引发的异常的信息，请参阅[异常处理](~/docs/standard/parallel-programming/exception-handling-task-parallel-library.md)。For information on handling exceptions thrown by task operations, see [Exception Handling](~/docs/standard/parallel-programming/exception-handling-task-parallel-library.md). ## Examples 下面的示例计算表示已发布的丛书的文本文件中单词的大致数目。The following example counts the approximate number of words in text files that represent published books. 每个任务负责打开的文件，以异步方式读取其整个内容并通过使用正则表达式计算字数统计。Each task is responsible for opening a file, reading its entire contents asynchronously, and calculating the word count by using a regular expression. 调用方法以确保显示到控制台的每本书的字数前已完成所有任务。The method is called to ensure that all tasks have completed before displaying the word count of each book to the console. [!code-csharp[System.Threading.Tasks.Task.Run#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task.run/cs/run3.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.Tasks.Task.Run#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task.run/vb/run3.vb#2)] 正则表达式`\p{P}*\s+`匹配零个、 一个或多个标点字符后跟一个或多个空白字符。The regular expression `\p{P}*\s+` matches zero, one, or more punctuation characters followed by one or more whitespace characters. 它假定匹配项的总数等于近似字数统计。It assumes that the total number of matches equals the approximate word count.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果该任务开始执行之前，已请求取消，才会执行该任务。If cancellation is requested before the task begins execution, the task does not execute. 改为设置为状态，则将引发异常。Instead it is set to the state and throws a exception. 方法是一个更简单的替代方法方法。The method is a simpler alternative to the method. 使用以下默认值，它创建一个任务：It creates a task with the following default values: - 其属性值是。Its property value is . - 它使用默认任务计划程序。It uses the default task scheduler. 有关处理由任务操作引发的异常的信息，请参阅[异常处理](~/docs/standard/parallel-programming/exception-handling-task-parallel-library.md)。For information on handling exceptions thrown by task operations, see [Exception Handling](~/docs/standard/parallel-programming/exception-handling-task-parallel-library.md). ## Examples 下面的示例创建 20 个将循环执行，直到计数器就会增加到 200 万个值的任务。The following example creates 20 tasks that will loop until a counter is incremented to a value of 2 million. 前 10 个任务进入 2000000，取消标记被取消，并其计数器未达到 200 万个的任何任务将被取消。When the first 10 tasks reach 2 million, the cancellation token is cancelled, and any tasks whose counters have not reached 2 million are cancelled. 该示例演示了可能的输出。The example shows possible output. [!code-csharp[System.Threading.Tasks.Task.Run#7](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task.run/cs/Run7.cs#7)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.Tasks.Task.Run#7](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task.run/vb/Run7.vb#7)] 而不是使用属性可以检查异常，该示例循环访问所有任务，以确定其成功完成，然后其已取消。Instead of using the property to examine exceptions, the example iterates all tasks to determine which have completed successfully and which have been cancelled. 对于那些已完成，它将显示任务返回的值。For those that have completed, it displays the value returned by the task. 取消是协作性的因为每个任务可以决定如何响应取消。Because cancellation is cooperative, each task can decide how to respond to cancellation. 下面的示例是类似的第，只不过任务后取消了令牌，则返回它们需要完成而不是引发异常的迭代数。The following example is like the first, except that, once the token is cancelled, tasks return the number of iterations they've completed rather than throw an exception. [!code-csharp[System.Threading.Tasks.Task.Run#28](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task.run/cs/Run28.cs#28)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.Tasks.Task.Run#28](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task.run/vb/Run28.vb#28)] 该示例仍必须处理异常，因为请求取消时未启动任何任务仍会引发异常。The example still must handle the exception, since any tasks that have not started when cancellation is requested still throw an exception.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 通常，任务在线程池线程上异步执行，并且不会阻止调用线程。Ordinarily, tasks are executed asynchronously on a thread pool thread and do not block the calling thread. 通过调用执行的任务方法了与当前并在调用线程上运行。Tasks executed by calling the method are associated with the current and are run on the calling thread. 如果目标计划程序不支持在调用线程上运行此任务，在计划程序，执行将安排任务和调用线程将受阻，直到任务完成执行。If the target scheduler does not support running this task on the calling thread, the task will be scheduled for execution on the scheduler, and the calling thread will block until the task has completed execution. 即使任务以同步方式运行，调用线程仍应调用来处理该任务可能会引发任何异常。Even though the task runs synchronously, the calling thread should still call to handle any exceptions that the task might throw. 异常处理的详细信息，请参阅[异常处理](~/docs/standard/parallel-programming/exception-handling-task-parallel-library.md)。For more information on exception handling, see [Exception Handling](~/docs/standard/parallel-programming/exception-handling-task-parallel-library.md). 通过调用执行的任务方法通过调用实例化或类构造函数。Tasks executed by calling the method are instantiated by calling a or class constructor. 以同步方式运行的任务必须在状态。The task to be run synchronously must be in the state. 可以启动任务，并将其只运行一次。A task may be started and run only once. 任何尝试计划任务引发异常的第二个时间结果。Any attempts to schedule a task a second time results in an exception. ## Examples 下面的示例将通过调用执行的任务进行比较方法和一个以异步方式执行。The following example compares a task executed by calling the method with one executed asynchronously. 在这两种情况下，任务执行相同的 lambda 表达式，它显示的任务 ID 和的线程 ID 上运行任务。In both cases, the tasks execute identical lambda expressions that display the task ID and the ID of the thread on which the task is running. 此任务计算介于 1 和 1000000 之间的整数的总和。The task calculates the sum of the integers between 1 and 1,000,000. 如示例输出所示，通过调用执行该任务方法而异步任务不在应用程序的线程上运行。As the output from the example shows, the task executed by calling the method runs on the application thread, while the asynchronous task does not. [!code-csharp[System.Threading.Tasks.Task.RunSynchronously#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task.runsynchronously/cs/runsynchronously1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.Tasks.Task.RunSynchronously#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task.runsynchronously/vb/runsynchronously1.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 通过调用执行的任务方法通过调用实例化或类构造函数。Tasks executed by calling the method are instantiated by calling a or class constructor. 以同步方式运行的任务必须在状态。The task to be run synchronously must be in the state. 可以启动任务，并将其只运行一次。A task may be started and run only once. 任何尝试计划任务引发异常的第二个时间结果。Any attempts to schedule a task a second time results in an exception. 如果目标计划程序不支持当前线程上运行此任务，该任务将安排执行在计划程序，并且当前线程将受阻，直到任务完成执行。If the target scheduler does not support running this task on the current thread, the task will be scheduled for execution on the scheduler, and the current thread will block until the task has completed execution. 因此，调用线程不需要调用的方法，如以确保任务已完成执行。Because of this, the calling thread does not need to call a method such as to ensure that the task has completed execution. 任务操作的异常处理的详细信息，请参阅[异常处理](~/docs/standard/parallel-programming/exception-handling-task-parallel-library.md)。For more information on exception handling for task operations, see [Exception Handling](~/docs/standard/parallel-programming/exception-handling-task-parallel-library.md).

remarks.format: ## Remarks 可以启动任务，并将其只运行一次。A task may be started and run only once. 第二次计划任务的任何尝试都将导致异常。Any attempts to schedule a task a second time will result in an exception. 用于执行的任务已通过调用之一创建构造函数。The is used to execute a task that has been created by calling one of the constructors. 通常情况下，你执行此操作时需要将从其执行，如有条件地执行你已创建的任务的任务的创建。Typically, you do this when you need to separate the task's creation from its execution, such as when you conditionally execute tasks that you've created. 对于更常见的情况，你不需要单独执行的任务实例化，我们建议你调用的重载或方法。For the more common case in which you don't need to separate task instantiation from execution, we recommend that you call an overload of the or method. 有关处理由任务操作引发的异常的信息，请参阅[异常处理](~/docs/standard/parallel-programming/exception-handling-task-parallel-library.md)。For information on handling exceptions thrown by task operations, see [Exception Handling](~/docs/standard/parallel-programming/exception-handling-task-parallel-library.md). ## Examples 下面的示例调用构造函数实例化一个新对象，它显示其任务 ID 和托管的线程 ID，然后执行一个循环。The following example calls the constructor to instantiate a new object that displays its task ID and managed thread ID and then executes a loop. 然后，它调用方法用于执行任务。It then calls the method to execute the task. 由于这是一个控制台应用程序，调用方法有必要阻止该应用程序终止之前在任务完成执行。Since this is a console app, the call to the method is necessary to prevent the app from terminating before the task finishes execution. remarks.format: ## Remarks 检索的值的属性不会阻止调用线程，直到任务完成。Retrieving the value of the property does not block the calling thread until the task has completed. 有关详细信息及示例，请参阅[使用延续任务来链接任务](~/docs/standard/parallel-programming/chaining-tasks-by-using-continuation-tasks.md)和[如何： 取消任务及其子](~/docs/standard/parallel-programming/how-to-cancel-a-task-and-its-children.md)。For more information and an example, see [Chaining Tasks by Using Continuation Tasks](~/docs/standard/parallel-programming/chaining-tasks-by-using-continuation-tasks.md) and [How to: Cancel a Task and Its Children](~/docs/standard/parallel-programming/how-to-cancel-a-task-and-its-children.md). ## Examples 下面的示例创建 20 个将循环执行，直到计数器就会增加到 200 万个值的任务。The following example creates 20 tasks that will loop until a counter is incremented to a value of 2 million. 前 10 个任务进入 2000000，取消标记被取消，并其计数器未达到 200 万个的任何任务将被取消。When the first 10 tasks reach 2 million, the cancellation token is cancelled, and any tasks whose counters have not reached 2 million are cancelled. 该示例然后检查属性的每个任务以指示它是否已成功完成或已被取消。The example then examines the property of each task to indicate whether it completed successfully or was cancelled. 对于那些已完成，它将显示任务返回的值。For those that completed, it displays the value returned by the task. [!code-csharp[System.Threading.Tasks.Task.Run#7](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task.run/cs/Run7.cs#7)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.Tasks.Task.Run#7](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task.run/vb/Run7.vb#7)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 是一种同步方法，导致调用线程等待，直到完成当前任务。 is a synchronization method that causes the calling thread to wait until the current task has completed. 如果当前任务尚未开始执行，等待方法尝试从调度器删除任务并在当前线程上执行它内联。If the current task has not started execution, the Wait method attempts to remove the task from the scheduler and execute it inline on the current thread. 如果无法做到这一点，或当前的任务已开始执行，它会阻止调用线程，直到任务完成。If it is unable to do that, or if the current task has already started execution, it blocks the calling thread until the task completes. 有关详细信息，请参阅[Task.Wait 和"内联"](http://blogs.msdn.com/b/pfxteam/archive/2009/10/15/9907713.aspx)中使用.NET 博客进行并行编程。For more information, see [Task.Wait and "Inlining"](http://blogs.msdn.com/b/pfxteam/archive/2009/10/15/9907713.aspx) in the Parallel Programming with .NET blog. 有关详细信息及示例，请参阅[如何： 等待一个或多个任务完成](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/79cb522b-9c93-46ed-b23a-c06908f3a374)。For more information and an example, see [How to: Wait on One or More Tasks to Complete](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/79cb522b-9c93-46ed-b23a-c06908f3a374). ## Examples 下面的示例启动生成介于 0 和 100 之间的一百万个随机整数，并计算其平均值的任务。The following example starts a task that generates one million random integers between 0 and 100 and computes their mean. 该示例使用方法，以确保在任务完成之前在应用程序终止。The example uses the method to ensure that the task completes before the application terminates. 否则，由于这是一个控制台应用程序，该示例将终止之前任务可以计算并显示平均值。Otherwise, because this is a console application, the example would terminate before the task can compute and display the mean. remarks.format: ## Remarks 是一种同步方法，导致调用线程等待当前的任务实例，以完成为止以下项之一： is a synchronization method that causes the calling thread to wait for the current task instance to complete until one of the following occurs: - 任务成功完成。The task completes successfully. - 任务本身被取消或引发异常。The task itself is canceled or throws an exception. 在这种情况下，处理异常。In this case, you handle an exception. 属性包含有关异常或异常的详细信息。The property contains details about the exception or exceptions. - 通过定义的间隔`millisecondsTimeout`间隔。The interval defined by `millisecondsTimeout` elapses. 在这种情况下，当前线程继续执行，并且该方法返回`false`。In this case, the current thread resumes execution and the method returns `false`. ## Examples 下面的示例启动生成 5000000，介于 0 和 100 之间的随机整数，并计算其平均值的任务。The following example starts a task that generates five million random integers between 0 and 100 and computes their mean. 该示例使用方法来等待应用程序在 150 毫秒内完成。The example uses the method to wait for the application to complete within 150 milliseconds. 如果应用程序正常完成，该任务将显示的总和和平均值的已生成随机数字。If the application completes normally, the task displays the sum and mean of the random numbers that it has generated. 如果超时间隔已过去，此示例将显示一条消息，在终止前。If the timeout interval has elapsed, the example displays a message before it terminates. [!code-csharp[System.Threading.Tasks.Task.Wait#5](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task.wait/cs/Wait5.cs#5)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.Tasks.Task.Wait#5](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task.wait/vb/Wait5.vb#5)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法创建可取消的等待; 也就是说，它会导致当前线程等待，直到出现以下之一：The method creates a cancelable wait; that is, it causes the current thread to wait until one of the following occurs: - 在任务完成。The task completes. - 取消标记被取消。The cancellation token is canceled. 在此情况下，调用方法抛出异常。In this case, the call to the method throws an . > [!NOTE] > 取消`cancellationToken`取消标记具有不会影响正在运行的任务，除非它还具有已通过的取消标记，并且准备好处理取消。Canceling the `cancellationToken` cancellation token has no effect on the running task unless it has also been passed the cancellation token and is prepared to handle cancellation. 传递`cancellationToken`对象对此方法只是让要取消等待。Passing the `cancellationToken` object to this method simply allows the wait to be canceled. ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何取消标记来取消等待完成任务的简单的使用。The following example illustrates the simple use of a cancellation token to cancel waiting for a task's completion. 任务启动、 调用方法来取消标记源的取消标记，然后延迟任一五秒内。A task is launched, calls the method to cancel any of the token source's cancellation tokens, and then delays for five seconds. 请注意任务本身尚未过去的取消标记，并且无法被取消。Note that the task itself has not been passed the cancellation token and is not cancelable. 应用程序线程调用该任务的后取消标记被取消并取消方法来等待任务完成，但在等待引发。The application thread calls the task's method to wait for the task to complete, but the wait is canceled once the cancellation token is cancelled and an is thrown. 异常处理程序将异常报告，然后休眠为六秒。The exception handler reports the exception and then sleeps for six seconds. 如示例输出所示，这种延迟使任务可以在完成状态。As the output from the example shows, that delay allows the task to complete in the state. [!code-csharp[System.Threading.Tasks.Task.Wait#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task.wait/cs/wait3.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.Tasks.Task.Wait#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task.wait/vb/wait3.vb#3)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 是一种同步方法，导致调用线程等待当前的任务实例，以完成为止以下项之一： is a synchronization method that causes the calling thread to wait for the current task instance to complete until one of the following occurs: - 任务成功完成。The task completes successfully. - 任务本身被取消或引发异常。The task itself is canceled or throws an exception. 在这种情况下，处理异常。In this case, you handle an exception. 属性包含有关异常或异常的详细信息。The property contains details about the exception or exceptions. - `cancellationToken`取消标记被取消。The `cancellationToken` cancellation token is canceled. 在此情况下，调用方法抛出异常。In this case, the call to the method throws an . - 通过定义的间隔`millisecondsTimeout`间隔。The interval defined by `millisecondsTimeout` elapses. 在这种情况下，当前线程继续执行，并且该方法返回`false`。In this case, the current thread resumes execution and the method returns `false`. > [!NOTE] > 取消`cancellationToken`取消标记具有不会影响正在运行的任务，除非它还具有已通过的取消标记，并且准备好处理取消。Canceling the `cancellationToken` cancellation token has no effect on the running task unless it has also been passed the cancellation token and is prepared to handle cancellation. 传递`cancellationToken`对象对此方法只允许等待要取消基于某些条件下，在。Passing the `cancellationToken` object to this method simply allows the wait to be canceled based on some condition. ## Examples 下面的示例调用方法以提供一个超时值和取消令牌，可以结束等待的任务完成。The following example calls the method to provide both a timeout value and a cancellation token that can end the wait for a task's completion. 新线程已启动并执行`CancelToken`方法，其中暂停，随后调用方法来取消取消标记。A new thread is started and executes the `CancelToken` method, which pauses and then calls the method to cancel the cancellation tokens. 任务启动，然后为 5 秒延迟。A task is then launched and delays for 5 seconds. 方法然后调用来等待任务完成，并且提供了简要超时值和取消标记。The method is then called to wait for the task's completion and is provided both a brief timeout value and a cancellation token. [!code-csharp[System.Threading.Tasks.Task.Wait#4](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task.wait/cs/wait4.cs#4)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.Tasks.Task.Wait#4](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task.wait/vb/wait4.vb#4)] 请注意，该示例的精确输出取决于是否在等待已取消的取消标记由于或因为超时间隔结束。Note that the precise output from the example depends on whether the wait was canceled because of the cancellation token or because the timeout interval elapsed.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 重载返回方法对象通常称为时您感兴趣或由一组任务引发的异常中的一组任务的状态。The overloads of the method that return a object are typically called when you are interested in the status of a set of tasks or in the exceptions thrown by a set of tasks. > [!NOTE] > 调用方法不会阻止调用线程。The call to method does not block the calling thread. 如果处于错误状态的任何提供的任务完成后，返回的任务还将在完成状态，其中延续的异常将包含的解包异常从每个提供的任务集的聚合。If any of the supplied tasks completes in a faulted state, the returned task will also complete in a state, where its exceptions will contain the aggregation of the set of unwrapped exceptions from each of the supplied tasks. 如果没有提供的任务出错，但至少一个已取消，则返回的任务将以结束状态。If none of the supplied tasks faulted but at least one of them was canceled, the returned task will end in the state. 如果没有任务错误状态，并且没有任务已取消，该结果任务将以结束状态。If none of the tasks faulted and none of the tasks were canceled, the resulting task will end in the state. 如果提供数组/可枚举不包含任何任务，则返回的任务将立即转换为状态，然后返回到调用方。If the supplied array/enumerable contains no tasks, the returned task will immediately transition to a state before it's returned to the caller. ## Examples 下面的示例创建一组数组中的 Url 进行 ping 操作的任务。The following example creates a set of tasks that ping the URLs in an array. 这些任务存储在`List`集合传递给方法。The tasks are stored in a `List` collection that is passed to the method. 在调用后方法可确保所有线程均已都完成，该示例检查属性来确定是否有出现故障的任何任务。After the call to the method ensures that all threads have completed, the example examines the property to determine whether any tasks have faulted. remarks.format: ## Remarks 调用方法不会阻止调用线程。The call to method does not block the calling thread. 但是，对返回的调用属性不会阻止调用线程。However, a call to the returned property does block the calling thread. 如果处于错误状态的任何提供的任务完成后，返回的任务还将在完成状态，其中延续的异常将包含的解包异常从每个提供的任务集的聚合。If any of the supplied tasks completes in a faulted state, the returned task will also complete in a state, where its exceptions will contain the aggregation of the set of unwrapped exceptions from each of the supplied tasks. 如果没有提供的任务出错，但至少一个已取消，则返回的任务将以结束状态。If none of the supplied tasks faulted but at least one of them was canceled, the returned task will end in the state. 如果没有任务错误状态，并且没有任务已取消，该结果任务将以结束状态。If none of the tasks faulted and none of the tasks were canceled, the resulting task will end in the state. 返回任务的属性将设置为在已提供包含所有相同顺序提供的任务的结果的数组 (例如如果输入任务包含的数组 t1、 t2、 t3，则输出任务属性将返回`TResult[]`其中`arr[0] == t1.Result, arr[1] == t2.Result, and arr[2] == t3.Result)`。The property of the returned task will be set to an array containing all of the results of the supplied tasks in the same order as they were provided (e.g. if the input tasks array contained t1, t2, t3, the output task's property will return an `TResult[]` where `arr[0] == t1.Result, arr[1] == t2.Result, and arr[2] == t3.Result)`. 如果`tasks`自变量包含任何任务，则返回的任务将立即转换为状态，然后返回到调用方。If the `tasks` argument contains no tasks, the returned task will immediately transition to a state before it's returned to the caller. 返回`TResult[]`将 0 个元素的数组。The returned `TResult[]` will be an array of 0 elements. ## Examples 下面的示例创建十个任务，其中每个实例化的随机数生成器创建 1,000 个介于 1 和 1000 之间的随机数，并计算其平均值。The following example creates ten tasks, each of which instantiates a random number generator that creates 1,000 random numbers between 1 and 1,000 and computes their mean. 方法使用延迟的随机数生成器的实例化，以便不会创建具有相同的种子值。The method is used to delay instantiation of the random number generators so that they are not created with identical seed values. 调用方法然后返回数组，其中包含平均值计算通过每个任务。The call to the method then returns an array that contains the mean computed by each task. 这些然后用于计算的总体平均值。These are then used to calculate the overall mean. [!code-csharp[System.Threading.Tasks.Task.WhenAll#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task.whenall/cs/whenall1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.Tasks.Task.WhenAll#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task.whenall/vb/whenall1.vb#1)] 在这种情况下，十个单个任务存储在对象。In this case, the ten individual tasks are stored in a object. 实现 接口。 implements the interface.

summary.span: 创建异步产生当前上下文的等待任务。

span.span: Creates an awaitable task that asynchronously yields back to the current context when awaited.

returns.span: 等待时，上下文将异步转换回等待时的当前上下文。

span.span: A context that, when awaited, will asynchronously transition back into the current context at the time of the await.

returns.span: 如果当前 不为 null，则将其视为当前上下文。

span.span: If the current is non-null, it is treated as the current context.

returns.span: 否则，与当前执行任务关联的任务计划程序将视为当前上下文。

span.span: Otherwise, the task scheduler that is associated with the currently executing task is treated as the current context.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 你可以使用`await Task.Yield();`在异步方法以强制方法以异步方式完成。You can use `await Task.Yield();` in an asynchronous method to force the method to complete asynchronously. 如果没有当前同步上下文 (对象)，这会将发布回该上下文的方法的执行的其余部分。If there is a current synchronization context ( object), this will post the remainder of the method’s execution back to that context. 但是，上下文将确定如何设置相对于其他工作可能处于挂起状态，此工作优先级。However, the context will decide how to prioritize this work relative to other work that may be pending. 在大多数 UI 环境出现在 UI 线程上的同步上下文将设置发布到高于输入和呈现工作上下文的工作通常优先级。The synchronization context that is present on a UI thread in most UI environments will often prioritize work posted to the context higher than input and rendering work. 因此，不要依赖于`await Task.Yield();`以使 UI 保持响应状态。For this reason, do not rely on `await Task.Yield();` to keep a UI responsive. 有关详细信息，请参阅文章[抽象启用有用 ContinueWith](http://blogs.msdn.com/b/pfxteam/archive/2008/07/23/8768673.aspx)中使用.NET 博客进行并行编程。For more information, see the entry [Useful Abstractions Enabled with ContinueWith](http://blogs.msdn.com/b/pfxteam/archive/2008/07/23/8768673.aspx) in the Parallel Programming with .NET blog.
